tool.name: SAGA.imagery_opencv.10
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayFEATURES True isArrayMODEL_LOAD False isArrayTRAIN_AREAS False isArrayTRAIN_CLASS False isArrayMODEL_SAVE False output_data_CLASSES $output_data_CLASSES name SAGA.imagery_opencv.10 FEATURES $FEATURES NORMALIZE $NORMALIZE RGB_COLORS $RGB_COLORS MODEL_LOAD $MODEL_LOAD TRAIN_AREAS $TRAIN_AREAS TRAIN_CLASS $TRAIN_CLASS TRAIN_BUFFER $TRAIN_BUFFER MODEL_SAVE $MODEL_SAVE MAX_DEPTH $MAX_DEPTH MIN_SAMPLES $MIN_SAMPLES MAX_CATEGRS $MAX_CATEGRS 1SE_RULE $1SE_RULE TRUNC_PRUNED $TRUNC_PRUNED REG_ACCURACY $REG_ACCURACY ACTIVE_VARS $ACTIVE_VARS prefer $prefer response $response outputType_CLASSES $OutputSection_CLASSES.outputType_CLASSES transmissionMode_CLASSES $OutputSection_CLASSES.transmissionMode_CLASSES

param.name: FEATURES
param.label: Features
param.help: Features The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-aaigrid, x-ogc-envi, png, tiff

param.name: RGB_COLORS
param.label: Update Colors from Features
param.help: Use the first three features in list to obtain blue, green, red components for class colour in look-up table.

param.name: MODEL_LOAD
param.label: Load Model
param.help: Use a model previously stored to file. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: plain

param.name: TRAIN_AREAS
param.label: Training Areas
param.help: Training Areas The following data types are allowed in the txt file: json, vnd.google-earth.kml+xml, xml

param.name: TRAIN_CLASS
param.label: Class Identifier
param.help: Class Identifier The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: TRAIN_BUFFER
param.label: Buffer Size
param.help: For non-polygon type training areas, creates a buffer with a diameter of specified size.

param.name: MODEL_SAVE
param.label: Save Model
param.help: Stores model to file to be used for subsequent classifications instead of training areas. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: plain

param.name: MAX_DEPTH
param.label: Maximum Tree Depth
param.help: The maximum possible depth of the tree. That is the training algorithms attempts to split a node while its depth is less than maxDepth. The root node has zero depth.

param.name: MIN_SAMPLES
param.label: Minimum Sample Count
param.help: If the number of samples in a node is less than this parameter then the node will not be split.

param.name: MAX_CATEGRS
param.label: Maximum Categories
param.help: Cluster possible values of a categorical variable into K<=maxCategories clusters to find a suboptimal split.

param.name: 1SE_RULE
param.label: Use 1SE Rule
param.help: If true then a pruning will be harsher. This will make a tree more compact and more resistant to the training data noise but a bit less accurate.

param.name: TRUNC_PRUNED
param.label: Truncate Pruned Trees
param.help: If true then pruned branches are physically removed from the tree. Otherwise they are retained and it is possible to get results from the original unpruned (or pruned less aggressively) tree.

param.name: REG_ACCURACY
param.label: Regression Accuracy
param.help: Termination criteria for regression trees. If all absolute differences between an estimated value in a node and values of train samples in this node are less than this parameter then the node will not be split further.

param.name: ACTIVE_VARS
param.label: Active Variable Count
param.help: The size of the randomly selected subset of features at each tree node and that are used to find the best split(s). If you set it to 0 then the size will be set to the square root of the total number of features.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_CLASSES
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: Integration of the OpenCV Machine Learning library for Random Forest classification of gridded features.
